name: Vojtěch Kocan
subtitle: Cyber Security Student | Brno, Czech Republic
about-text: I am a 4th-year cyber security student at the Secondary School of Informatics in Brno. I love technology – from computer diagnostics to developing innovative projects like a remote-controlled formula car. I hold certifications in cyber security and hardware, actively tutor mathematics and physics, and am seeking opportunities to apply my technical skills and passion for the future of the digital world.
exp1-desc: Providing technical support and maintenance for local infrastructure.
exp2-desc: Individual tutoring in mathematics and physics with a focus on effective learning.
exp3-desc: Diagnosing and repairing computers, addressing hardware and software issues.
exp4-time: South Moravian Region, Internship | May 2025 – June 2025
exp4-desc: Supporting projects in cyber security and implementing security measures.
exp5-time: Secondary School of Informatics, Brno | October 2022 – February 2024
exp5-desc: Creating content for the school magazine and developing communication skills.
edu1-desc: Specialization in cyber security and Decree No. 82/2018.
edu2-time: English Language and Literature | July 2025 – August 2025
cert1: Cyber Security Manager – National Cyber and Information Security Agency (May 2025 – May 2027, ID: 059-2080)
cert3: CES English Course Certificate B1 – Centre of English Studies (August 2025)
course1: Erasmus Germany – Secondary School of Informatics, Brno
award1: Successful Participant in the Regional Round of the Astronomy Olympiad 2024 (April 2024)
qa-question1: What inspired you to focus on cyber security?
qa-answer1: My passion for technology and problem-solving led me to cyber security. I was fascinated by how vulnerabilities in systems could be exploited and wanted to learn how to protect digital infrastructures. Participating in hackathons and working on real-world projects further fueled my interest in securing the future of technology.
qa-question2: How do you approach new projects?
qa-answer2: I start by defining clear goals and researching the problem space. Then, I break the project into manageable tasks, prioritize security and efficiency, and iterate based on testing and feedback. Collaboration and staying updated with the latest tech trends are key to my approach.
qa-question3: Can I collaborate with you on a project?
qa-answer3: Absolutely, I’m open to collaboration! Feel free to reach out via email or LinkedIn to discuss potential projects. I’m particularly interested in cyber security, hardware, or innovative tech ideas that align with my skills and passions.
